localizedDescriptions.en: Document to communicate information to others about the result of a test or assessment.
The findings and interpretation of a pathology laboratory test performed on patient-related specimens.

annotations.comment: This archetype may be used to record a single valued test, but will often be specialised or templated to represent multiple value or 'panel' tests. This archetype also acts as the parent for specialisations appropriate for more specific laboratory tests, e.g. microbiology, histopathology.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the pathology test performed, sometimes including specimen type and patient state.

annotations.comment: A test result may be for a single analyte, or a group of items, including panel tests. Coding with a terminology, potientially a pre-coordinated term including specimen type, is preferred, where possible. May be coded with LOINC or Snomed-CT. Examples include "Glucose", "Urea and Electrolytes", "Swab",  “Cortisol (am)” or "Liver Biopsy".

localizedDescriptions.en: To record details of a laboratory specimen.
The type of specimen to be collected e.g venous blood, prostatic biopsy.
The date and time that collection has been ordered to take place or has taken place.
The method of collection to be used eg Venepuncture, biopsy, resection.
Workflow of specimen processing/handling.
The date and time that the sample was received at the laboratory.
The status of the laboratory test result as a whole.
The existence of the test is registered in the Laboratory Information System, but there is nothing yet available.
This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) Test Result: data in the Test Result may be incomplete or unverified.
The Test result is complete and verified by an authorised person.
The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist.
The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist, and result data has been changed.
The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').
The Test Result has been withdrawn following previous Final release.
The date and/or time that the entire result was issued for the recorded ‘Test Report Status’.
Description of clinical information available at the time of interpretation of results, which may include a link to the original clinical information provided in the test request.

annotations.comment: In HL7 fhir this information is held within the linked requestDetail.clinical Notes.

localizedDescriptions.en: Laboratory test result as a single value or in a panel/battery format common to clinical pathology testing.
Specific detailed result, including both the value of the result item, and additional information that may be useful for clinical interpretation.
Actual value of the result. The name of this element is normally replaced in a template or at run-time to relfect the actual analyte e.g. Serum sodium and will often be coded.
Actual value of the result. The name of this element is normally replaced in a template or at run-time to relfect the actual analyte e.g. Serum sodium and will often be coded.
Actual value of the result. The name of this element is normally replaced in a template or at run-time to relfect the actual analyte e.g. Serum sodium and will often be coded.
Comment about the Result.
The status of the result value.
No result yet available.
This is an initial or interim result: data may be missing or verification not been performed.
The result is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist.
The result has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by the responsible pathologist.
The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed.
The result is not available as the test was not requested.
Concise and clinically contextualised narrative interpretation of the laboratory test results.
Details of an organisation
Name of the organisation
Details concerning a single laboratory test requested.

annotations.comment: Usually there is one test request (or "order") for each result, however in some circumstances multiple test requests may be represented using a single Pathology test result archetype.

localizedDescriptions.en: The local ID assigned to the test order by the order requester.

annotations.comment: Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier.

localizedDescriptions.en: The local ID assigned to the test order by the order filler, usually by the Laboratory Information System (LIS).

annotations.comment: Assigning an identifier to a request by the Laboratory lnformation System (LIS) enables tracking progress of the request and enables linking results to requests. It also provides a reference to assist with enquiries and it is usually equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier.

localizedDescriptions.en: Professional demographics details including name(s) , addresse(s) and telecommunication contact details.
Details of personal name of an individual, provider or third party.
Name in structured format.
Given / personal / first name.
Family name or Surname.
Professional identifier of the individual.
